intro: Athamanta cretensis var. glabra, commonly known as the Cretan smooth athamanta, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Crete. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant is distinguished by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves, which contribute to its varietal name "glabra." It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native region.
